;即使华盛顿的美元“武器化”正在推动更多发展中国家接受美元一位著名经济学家表示，人民币对中国的海外资产构成了巨大的威胁，北京必须动态完善其人民币国际化计划。

;

;“中国资产的安全已日益成为一个地缘政治问题， ”中国人民银行前政策顾问余永定周三在一篇文章中写道。

;

;“美元武器化彻底摧毁了国际货币体系赖以生存的国家信用”，现任北京支持的智库中国金融 40 人论坛的学术顾问。

;

;中国在 2019 年削减了 1050 亿美元，即 11% 的美国国债持有量。去年至 5 月，人们越来越担心美国因俄罗斯 2022 年 2 月入侵乌克兰而实施制裁，冻结了价值 3000 亿美元的俄罗斯央行资产。

;

;“人民币国际化是工具之一这位直言不讳的经济学家表示：“优化跨境资源配置、确保中国海外资产安全是最终目的，而不是最终目标。”

;

;为什么中国的人民币国际化进程未能达到预期？

;

;为什么中国的人民币国际化进程未能达到预期？ h3>;

;人民币国际地位的上升部分取决于美元地位的下降，而俄罗斯和乌克兰的冲突加速了资产多元化的进程。

;

;对北京人民币野心的评估，它始于 2009 年的贸易结算，当时人民币及其数字货币和跨境支付系统受到许多发展中国家的欢迎。

;

;而巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉达 (Luiz Inacio Lula da)席尔瓦在4月访华期间公开呼吁以本币结算，而不是通过美元，阿根廷政府也通过双边货币互换计划获得人民币来偿还国际货币基金组织债务。

;

;中国政府不同意人民币海外使用并未设定量化目标，但领导层希望有序发展。学者和智库经常提到到 2035 年使人民币与美元和欧元平起平坐的目标。

;

;根据北京人民大学一周前发布的一份报告，人民币国际化指数 – 评估在国际贸易、外汇储备和交易中的使用方面，去年的得分为 6.4 分（满分 100 分）。

;

;这是人民币迄今为止的最高评级，但远远落后于美元人民币兑美元汇率分别为 50.5 和 25.16。

;

;人民币在 Swift 全球支付清单中也排名第五，6 月份的份额为 2.77%，远远落后于美元的 42% 或欧元兑美元汇率为 21.25%。

;

;余表示，制裁相当于国际金融布雷顿森林体系的崩溃，这是 1971 年美国总统理查德·尼克松 (Richard Nixon) 宣布“临时”制裁的里程碑事件。暂停美元与黄金的兑换。

;

;“地缘政治变化为人民币在国际舞台上发挥更大作用带来了机遇，”他说。

;

;人民币“新选择”随着全球最大的贸易协议在亚太地区打开大门

;

;俄罗斯在被拒绝使用美元后，随后开始在贸易、外汇交易和储备中使用人民币。

;

;根据对中国海关而言，2022年俄中贸易额创历史新高，达1903亿美元，比上年增长29.3%。今年一季度达到538亿美元，同比增长38.7%。

;

;3月份，俄罗斯居民个人购买人民币价值增至419亿卢布（美元）俄罗斯央行数据显示，2 月份的汇率为 116 亿卢布（4.5 亿美元）。

;

;通过签署货币互换协议，加速了许多国家，特别是发展中国家央行的外汇多元化努力。截至7月，已有70多家境外央行类机构进入中国银行间债券市场，超过75个国家和地区的货币当局已将人民币纳入其货币市场

;

;在余看来，货币互换协议更多地反映了国际货币市场“去美元化”的趋势，特别是发展中国家为摆脱困境而做出的努力。

;

;“去美元化不是周期性波动，而是长期趋势，”他补充道。

;

; p>;

;根据日经指数上周的分析，第二季度人民币占中国跨境交易的 49%，季度数据首次超过美元。​​

;< p>;然而，人民币在国际上的更多使用也将伴随着更大的风险，正如 1997 年的泰铢危机和一年后的港元危机所体现的那样。

;

;中国需要加快人民币的发展于补充说，通过结构性改革来扩大内需并实现贸易平衡。

;香港高等法院命令被监禁的媒体大亨黎智英支付他针对政府决定禁止一名英国律师在串谋审判中代表他提出的两次法律挑战，但均以失败告终，并称这些尝试“完全没有道理”。

;

;高等法院首席法官潘肇（Jeremy Poon Shiu） -chor 周四表示，黎智英“无理地坚持”4 月 11 日启动的两项诉讼，尽管司法部在两天后的一封信中告诉他，这些诉讼“完全且明显无可争议”。

;

;“申请人已被建议停止司法审查程序，因为判决中阐明的实质性原因缺乏法律依据，如果他不这样做，我们将向他寻求赔偿费用，”他在一份书面判决中说。< /p>;

;“申请人本应按照建议行事，但无理坚持。这是不合理的诉讼行为，需要赔偿费用。”

;

;创办现已解散的《苹果日报》的黎智英将于 9 月在没有陪审团的情况下接受审判，罪名是煽动叛乱和串谋煽动叛乱。 ”

;

;中国最高立法机构全国人民代表大会常务委员会去年12月裁定，香港维护国家安全委员会应就是否允许海外律师参与拥有最终决定权

;

;由行政长官李家超担任主席的委员会于一月份裁定欧文代表黎智英可能会损害国家安全，并建议入境事务处拒绝任何申请

;

;香港法官阻止了黎智英提出阻止 iPhone 使用的最终上诉

;

;但直到黎智英开始审理此案后，这些决定才被透露给黎智英。二月份发起传票诉讼，寻求法院宣布全国人民代表大会常务委员会的解释不适用于他的案件。黎智英在了解这些决定后，于四月发起司法复核，要求法院推翻这些决定。

;

;但他的尝试徒劳无功，因为高等法院于五月驳回了他关于委员会决定无效的论点。潘周四表示，律政司四月份致黎智英的一封信中指出，委员会的决定是“最终的、具有约束力的、不可修改的司法审查”，司法审查是“明显没有根据，完全没有法律依据”，原传票是“学术性的，注定会失败”。

;

;判决还提到了黎智英不应该被责令支付诉讼费的论点。

;

; >;

;黎智英表示，律政司司长在提出质疑之前“在与律师的通信中没有提及这些决定”，而且“并不明显”北京对国家安全法的解释允许委员会就欧文的参与。

;

;香港高等法院驳回黎智英撤销国家安全案件的请求

;

;他辩称，原传票程序“纯粹是因为政务司司长的行为而变得学术性”。正义”。

;

;“关于司法审查程序，申请人提出，这符合最大的公共利益……并且提出了公共机构是否可以做出影响公众权利的决定的问题。判决书援引赖的说法。

;

;“在这种情况下，一般规则是不应责令司法复核申请不成功的人支付费用。” ”

;

;Poon 表示，司法复核申请人不会被要求支付被申请人或利害关系人的费用，除非在特殊或不寻常的情况下证明这一要求是合理的。

;

;他表示，尽管黎智英申请司法复核是基于公共利益，但由于国家安全法并未赋予法院对该委员会的管辖权，因此“完全没有道理”。

;

;洪香港国安法：英国称黎智英案向中国国家副主席提出

;

;“另一方面，申请人对解释的解读完全错误；他对越权规则的依赖完全是错误的，”他写道，指的是超出政府机构或公司权力范围的行为。

;

;“他打算申请司法审查，这是明显且完全无可争议的。 ”

;

;他补充说，赖在提交复审申请时并不知道委员会的决定，“但这并不能免除他对费用的责任”。

;香港首富的两家旗舰公司长和控股与长实集团李嘉诚报告称，由于高利率环境继续给香港企业带来压力，上半年盈利有所下降。

;

;长和是一家业务涵盖港口和基础设施的综合企业，电信和超市称，净利润暴跌 41%，至 112 亿港元（14.3 亿美元）。

;

;李嘉诚的旗舰房地产开发商长实集团表示，其 6 个月期间的利润下降了 18.9% % 至 103 亿港元。

;

;房地产销售收入暴跌 60% 至 82.5 亿港元，其中香港收入约占一半。

;

;“对于其余地区来说，李嘉诚的长子、两家公司的董事长李泽钜在长和提交的一份文件中表示，预计今年经济状况仍将充满挑战，通胀上升或持续加剧以及增长放缓带来下行风险。周四下午将在香港证券交易所上市。

;

;“随着利率上升和信贷环境收紧的长期影响打压市场情绪，消费者和企业信心尤其可能继续疲软。”

;

; >;

;该结果公布一周前，香港利率在 17 个月内第 11 次上涨，融资成本达到 2007 年 12 月以来的最高水平。上周四，香港金融管理局 (HKMA)，事实上的金融机构香港央行将本地基准利率上调 25 个基点至 5.75%，与美联储同步。

;

;第二季度香港经济增长放缓至 1.5%与上一年相比，2023 年香港经济从冠状病毒大流行中复苏陷入困境。

;

;长和的收入下降 3%，至 2,239 亿港元。由于“全球消费品需求停滞以及 2022 年底美国和欧洲的库存积累”，其港口和集装箱业务下降了 12%。

;

;尽管遭遇挫折，两家公司表示将向股东派发股息。长和宣布派发中期股息每股 0.756 港元，较之前水平减少 10%，而长实则维持每股 0.43 港元的股息。

;

;公告公布前，两家公司股价均下跌。长和股价下跌 1.4%，至 46.30 港元，而长江实业则下跌 1.5%，至 43.05 港元。

;

;在长实集团的一份文件中，李引用了全球经济不确定性和利率上升的背景：这是导致开发商业绩不佳的两个主要原因。

;

;“尽管第一季度有所改善，但香港的整体房地产市场状况在回顾期内仍然充满挑战。”

;< p>;他表示，公司有信心潜在需求和购买力将长期支持房地产市场。

;

;“住房政策和利率变动将继续是决定因素，”他补充道。< /p>;

;长江实业周四还公布了位于油塘的全新海岸线II住宅项目的价单。

;

;第一份价单提供高达19%的折扣，因为开发商试图吸引低迷市场中的买家。

;

;名单中最便宜的公寓是一套 210 平方英尺的单间公寓，折价 18% 后售价为 290 万港元，即每平方英尺 13,810 港元。

;

;单位折扣售价介乎290万至1,114万港元，平均每平方尺为15,000港元。

;

;同区又一发展项目推出去年，Chill Residence 的平均售价为每平方英尺 17,938 港元。

;

;由于利率上升打压了买家情绪，香港的一级市场已经降温。近期推出的两个新项目——黄竹坑La Montague 及元朗High Park I 反应冷淡。

;超过 80% 的清洁工没有完全遵守政府新的休息指南香港关注团体进行的一项调查显示，许多工人认为工作量大是预防中暑的主要原因。

;

;关注草根民生联盟对96名清洁工进行了11项垃圾调查旺角7月14日至23日期间的收集点周四表示，指引与工人所面临的状况脱节。

;

;“研究结果显示， “这些指导方针实际上并不符合一线工人的工作条件。”社区组织者 Ivy Hui Wun-wun 说。 “工人们不休息的原因有很多，比如工作量大，或者没有真正理解指引。”

;

;劳工处根据香港酷暑推出新三级预警系统5 月 15 日指数。根据指导方针，根据工作类型，可以暂停工作或分配 15 至 45 分钟的休息时间。

;

;但根据该联盟的数据，只有 18.8% 的受访者表示清洁工完全遵守了指导方针，其余81.2%（即78人）表示他们没有完全遵循建议。

;

;在后者中，37.5%（即36人）没有遵循这些建议。

;

;香港建筑和清洁行业放弃令人困惑的防暑规定

;

;在 78 名清洁工中，大多数受访者（73.1%）给出的首要原因是休息后仍要完成工作，24.4%的受访者表示宁愿早点完成工作，然后到垃圾收集站休息。

;

;其他回应包括担心被视为懒惰缺乏休息场所或不需要休息。

;

;“即使工人愿意遵守指导方针或公司告诉他们可以休息，工人也无法休息，因为他们的工作量太大了， ”许说。

;

;香港老板处境尴尬？新防暑指南保护工人

;

;该组织表示，另一个问题是对新指南缺乏认识，46名接受调查的清洁工表示，他们完全不知道这些建议。

;< p>;但该联盟表示，繁重的工作量是清洁工面临的最大障碍，因为这阻碍了他们休息，并补充说，他们的职责也使他们无法检查手机上的高温警报。

;

;许说，该联盟希望政府和相关部门能够评估一线员工的工作量问题来解决问题，比如看人员数量。

;中国互联网监管机构将要求所有处理个人数据的公司定期进行合规审计，包括对向海外实体提供的数据进行安全检查。

;

;所有拥有超过 100 万用户的公司每年都必须对其遵守用户个人数据管理规则的情况进行至少一次审核。中国国家互联网信息办公室周四发布了一项规定草案。

;

;用户数量低于 100 万的服务提供商必须每两年进行一次审计。

;

;网信办正在征求公众意见草案反馈期为一个月，截至9月2日。

;

;对向境外发送的数据的审核将包括检查个人信息是否提供给境外司法或执法机构，以及是否在收到数据后进行。需要获得中国当局的批准。

;

;公司还必须审查数据处理人员是否了解数据发送到的国家或地区的个人信息保护政策和网络安全环境。

;

;此外，审计预计将确保公司遵守针对海外发送的数据和信息的现有安全评估要求。用户超过 100 万的公司需要官方安全批准才能与海外各方共享信息。自上一年1月1日起向境外实体提供10万以上用户数据或1万以上用户敏感数据的，也必须获得批准并进行审核。

;

;国家网信办表示，该条例草案旨在依据《个人信息保护法》等法律法规，为个人数据保护“提供指导和规范合规审核”。

;

;贵州数据交换开创了中国个人数据交易的先河。数据

;

;处理个人数据的公司也将被要求采取措施，确保海外接收者按照中国个人信息法处理数据。

;

;合规审计应重点审查数据是否根据草案规定，处理者了解境外实体的数据保护情况。

;

;还应检查接收者是否了解中国相关法律法规，是否采取措施确保接收者履行义务他们在数据保护方面的义务。

;

;中国透露了建立数据执法超级机构的计划

;

;此时，北京正在加强对中国大陆以外的实体访问中国数据的保护。

;

; >;

;2021 年，中国监管机构以数据安全风险和“国家安全”相关的担忧为由，否决了共享出行巨头滴滴出行在纽约上市的申请。

;

;与此同时，北京方面已近年来，中国也一直在寻求加强对个人数据处理方式的控制和监督。

;

;“沙特优先事项”推动了沙特阿拉伯与中国之间日益增长的科技合作”，卡内基国际和平基金会的一份新报告称。

;

;“沙特阿拉伯与中国在技术和科学创新方面的合作正在不断增加——而沙特的优先事项正在引导这种关系，”这家总部位于华盛顿的智库在周二发布的报告中表示。

;

;报告称，中国和沙特阿拉伯 — — 海湾最富有的国家和美国的长期战略伙伴 — — 一直在科技领域加强合作in recent years as Beijing channels its global ambitions into the Middle East in rivalry with Washington.

;

;Those ambitions saw Beijing broker a deal in March between Saudi Arabia and Iran to restore ties, seven years after they were severed. It was announced soon after Chinese President Xi Jinping made a state visit to Saudi Arabia and signed over 30 deals including for investments in technology.

;

;But according to the think tank, the increasing tech cooperation between the two countries is born out of Saudi Arabia's push to boost its technology sector, and it said China served as an actor for Saudi Arabia to realise its national priorities.

;

;Saudi Arabia has long sought to position itself as a global science leader as it accumulated huge wealth through its oil, the report said, pointing to its Vision 2030 project launched in 2016 to diversify away from oil.

;

;The nation's GDP dedicated to research and development in 2020 was more than eight times the size it was two decades ago, according to Unesco data.

;

;Since Xi's first state visit to Saudi Arabia in 2016 – followed by a visit to China by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman – a coordination committee has been set up to accelerate and expand technology exchanges. The report also noted that Saudi Arabia had signed an agreement with China's top economic planner to foster engagement in technology.

;

;A piece of cake? China-Saudi Arabia embrace ties, but it's not all sweet success

;

;The official partnership framework has also paved the way for Chinese private companies to enter the Saudi market, which has seen Huawei Technologies become a major player in the country's 5G networks.

;

;The report said cooperation had been centred around localisation. That includes tech transfers that benefit locals, and Chinese companies being required to hire a certain percentage of Saudi nationals.

;

;It said there were signs of growth in the amount of capital being invested in science and technology between the two countries, but it is driven by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, or PIF – one of the largest sovereign wealth funds in the world.

;

;And despite the growing ties with China, there remains a strong preference among Saudi elites to work with the West on science and tech, according to the report. It said more than 60 per cent of the international collaborations in Saudi Arabia's academic institutions were with Western institutions.

;

;It noted that the King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology's programme for tech leaders – which aims to nurture partnerships with other top institutes around the world – does not include any Chinese universities. The report also said that while a few thousand Saudi students had gone to China to study science in the past decade through government-led programmes, most Saudi scientists had been trained in the West.

;

;The research was sponsored by the Ford Foundation, a non-profit based in New York.

;The crime-fighting prowess of a young police officer in China has been recognised with the presentation of a pennant banner which reads “Handsome and solved case quickly”.

;

;Despite being just 24, Tang Jiaqi, from Ningbo in Zhejiang province, eastern China, has taken part in several major investigations in the first year of his public security career after graduating from Zhejiang Police College, according to Ningbo Evening News.

;

;On July 1, a local resident, surnamed Li, left his photography equipment in an unlocked car allowing two thieves to steal the items.

;

;After Li reported the incident the following day, Tang quickly arrived at the scene and began a meticulous investigation.

;

;Tang's efforts, which included pouring over hours of public surveillance videos and several days of overtime, led to his successful arrest of two suspects on July 12.

;

;However, by the time the arrests had been made, the stolen equipment had already entered the black market, making its retrieval extremely challenging.

;

;Even Li, the victim, had lost hope of recovering his property, but Tang did not give up.

;

;After a few days of relentless detective work, Tang finally discovered that the stolen items had been resold to a shop in Beijing, after which he contacted the shop manager and recovered the property.

;

;Tang's dedication and crime-fighting abilities touched Li, who, to show his appreciation, presented Tang with a pennant banner that read “Handsome and solved case quickly.”

;

;“He is so handsome and dedicated that I wanted to give him this pennant,” said Li.

;

;Outside of police work, Tang enjoys football and playing the saxophone. He said that such activities help him recharge and stay focused on his investigative work.

;

;The award has also resonated with many on mainland social media.

;

;One person said: “Being handsome is a gift from his parents, but the ability to solve cases quickly is a testament to his professional skills.”

;

;Another added: “This pennant is a genuine and sincere expression of gratitude. It is straightforward and concise.”

;

;“A well-deserved piece of recognition!” agreed a third.

;

;The hashtag of “Citizen presents a pennant banner to police officer, praising him for being handsome and solving cases quickly” has gone viral on mainland social media.

;

;It also reminded people of another police officer, Wang Wenfei, from Qujing in the southwestern province of Yunnan, who received a similar pennant banner in 2020.

;

;After a middle school teacher reported the theft of a laptop worth 5,100 yuan (US$700) on November 23, Wang quickly identified and matched the suspect to another theft based on a very sketchy description, leading to the speedy recovery of the stolen item, reported the People's Daily.

;Donald Trump is expected to appear on Thursday in a Washington federal court to face new charges that he conspired to obstruct the 2020 presidential election – the third criminal case against the former president as he seeks a new term in the White House.

;

;The hearing on Thursday afternoon at the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Courthouse is likely to be short, but it's an important step in kicking off the latest case brought by Special Prosecutor Jack Smith.

;

;Trump is expected to be arraigned in person – which means he'll enter an initial plea to the charges – though the court has yet to announce specific details about the hearing.

;

;Before that, Trump will be processed by the court, which will be similar to the former president's experience in Florida after he was indicted in June over his handling of classified documents, US Marshals Service spokesman Drew Wade said.

;

;Trump's campaign finances are strained as legal peril mounts

;

;Wade confirmed that Trump:

;

;– will have his fingerprints taken digitally

;

;– will be required to provide his social security number, date of birth, address, and other personal information

;

;– won't have photograph taken, since he's already easily recognisable and there are already many photographs available

;

;Trump won't be placed under arrest, according to Wade. In accepting the indictment on Tuesday, US Magistrate Judge Moxila Upadhyaya issued a summons for his appearance, not an arrest warrant.

;

;The former president will then head into the courtroom for his appearance. The summons was issued by Upadhyaya, so the expectation is he'll appear before her, but the case has been assigned to US District Judge Tanya Chutkan, who was appointed by former President Barack Obama.

;

;The court hasn't put the hearing on the public calendar to confirm whose courtroom he'll go to.

;

;During the hearing, Trump's lawyers will likely do most, if not all, of the talking. The government didn't ask to put Trump in pretrial custody while the Florida case proceeds, and there's no expectation they'll ask for that now.

;

;If prosecutors want the judge to impose any conditions on his release, however, they could make those requests, and Trump's lawyers would have a chance to raise objections.

;

;In Florida, prosecutors asked that Trump be restricted from contacting witnesses about the case unless it was through his lawyers.

;

;The new indictment on Tuesday accused Trump of knowingly spreading lies about the 2020 election being rigged to undermine faith in the vote and to remain in power.

;

;Trump's bid to quash Georgia investigation rejected by judge

;

;Trump is charged with conspiracy to defraud the US, conspiracy to obstruct an official proceeding, obstruction of and attempt to obstruct an official proceeding, and conspiracy against the right to vote and have that vote counted.

;

;A third criminal case is pending in New York, where Trump was charged over alleged hush-money payments to an adult film actress who claimed she had an affair with him.

;

;Trump pleaded not guilty in New York and Florida, and he's derided the criminal cases against him as politically motivated. In a statement on Tuesday, his campaign said the Washington indictment involved “fake charges” brought by President Joe Biden's “weaponised Department of Justice” to interfere with the 2024 election.
